name: multicelled
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
of an organism or electrical device, having more than one cell: multicelled organisms/animals Slime mould is one of a group of single- to multi-celled organisms having characteristics of both plants and animals. They are working on battery packaging construction for multicelled batteries.
More examplesFewer examplesMore than 95 per cent of all multicelled animals on earth today have eyes.Multi-celled organisms date back to about 600,000,000 years ago.The Mountadam beaches were laid down before multi-celled life began. The Cambrian is a period distinguished by the sudden appearance of an astonishing array of multicelled animals.Many of the early multicelled creatures were similar to jellyfish and, like sea anemones, circular in appearance.
